definition: A term referring to a prestigious designation bestowed upon individuals, typically inherited or granted by a monarch or governing body, denoting high social rank or nobility. It is commonly used to describe titles that indicate noble status within a hierarchical system.

examples.english: He bears the noble title of Count.

examples.german: Der Adelstitel wird oft mit einem Adelsprädikat verbunden.
examples.english: The noble title is often associated with a nobiliary particle.
She holds the noble title of Duchess.

examples.german: Der Adelstitel wird in manchen Ländern offiziell anerkannt.
examples.english: The noble title is officially recognized in some countries.
